masterService.title: Master Service
masterService.description: Learn about the Master Service for managing master data and settings in a multi-tenant environment.
masterService.overview.title: Overview
masterService.overview.description: The Master Service consists of two main components
masterService.masterDataService.title: Master Data Service
masterService.masterDataService.feature1: Implements CRUD operations for master data entities
masterService.masterDataService.feature4: Ensures data integrity across tenant boundaries
masterService.masterSettingService.title: Master Setting Service
masterService.masterSettingService.featu: Supports creation of settings at all levels
Provides update and delete operations for tenant settings
masterService.installation.title: Installation
masterService.basicUsage.title: Basic Usage
masterService.apiReference.title: API Reference
masterService.apiReference.masterDataSer: Creates a new master data entity
Updates an existing master data entity
masterService.apiReference.masterSetting: Creates a new setting at the specified level
Retrieves settings for a user, cascading through the hierarchy
Returns merged settings from user → group → tenant → common levels
masterService.hierarchicalSettings.title: Hierarchical Settings Management
masterService.hierarchicalSettings.descr: Settings are managed in a hierarchical structure with four levels:
masterService.hierarchicalSettings.level: Group Level: Settings shared by a group of users
masterService.hierarchicalSettings.retri: Settings are retrieved in a cascading manner, where more specific settings override more general ones
Result combines settings from all levels, with user-level settings taking precedence
masterService.integration.title: Integration with Tenant Service
masterService.integration.description: The Master Service works in conjunction with the Tenant Service to ensure proper data isolation and access control.
masterService.integration.seeAlsoDetails: for more details about tenant management.
